column4: hi.  I have a problem with my loopback device configuration.  my lo is only assigned an ipv6 address, not an ipv4.  '/etc/init.d/networking start' doesn't work, nor does 'ifup lo'.  I have to manually enter the command 'ifconfig -s lo 127.0.0.1' in order to have a proper configuration.
is there some other file I should be looking for network configuration?  I'm looking at /etc/network/interfaces
What exactly do you need help with?
I would like to try to figure out why my loopback device isn't being configured properly at boot.
what exactly is the loopback device saying?
'ifconfig lo' reports an assigned ipv6 address, but not an ipv4 address.  This is causing numerous problems for me.
ok...Well, do you have an IPv6 server running?
I'm not sure.  what kind of server do you mean, a dns server?  And how could I tell?
Nevermind...Just go to a terminal and type in "ifconfig lo down" then type "ifconfig lo add 127.0.0.1/8" and finally "ifconfig lo up"
before you bring the interface back up, type "ifconfig lo del" and the IPv6 address and prefix
That's wierd...127.0.0.1/8 is the default address for a loopback adapter
Hmm...Very wierd indeed...I've never seen this happen before in my 11 years working on computers
when I do 'ifconfig -s lo 127.0.0.1' then all works as expected.
